net.java.jddac.jmdi.fblock
Class BasicTIM

java.lang.Object
  net.java.jddac.common.fblock.Entity
      net.java.jddac.jmdi.fblock.FunctionBlock
          net.java.jddac.jmdi.fblock.BasicTIM
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConfigurationInterface, SubscriberCallback, TIMInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
CSVFileTIM, MemoryUsage, OneWireTIM, PingStim, RandomData, SimpleCounter, SimulatedTIM
public abstract class BasicTIM
extends FunctionBlock
implements TIMInterface

Abstract class providing basic TIM functionality. This class implements much of the 'housekeeping' necessary to support the TIMInterface. As a result, classes that derive from this class only need to provide a few methods in order to fully support the behaviuors specified by the TIMInterface. In order to simplify derived classes, each different sensor (input) or actuator (output) provided by the transducer is treated as a channel numbered from 1 to N where N is the number of different transducer inputs and outputs. Each channel is named and associated with a channel number in ascending order. The channel name is used by the basic read and write methods. Channel zero has a special meaning which is interpreted to mean 'all channels'. This is consistent with the IEEE1451.2 standard. Derived classes must implement one or both of the read methods readChannel and readChannels as well as the getMetaId method. Default implementations of the other TIMInterface methods are provided by BasicTIM. The BasicTIM class also implements a configure method which can be used to configure the idPrefix as well as other meta data information.

Field Detail

OpIdGetAllTeds

protected static final java.lang.String OpIdGetAllTeds
See Also:
Constant Field Values

pubMetaData

public boolean pubMetaData
Set to true when results should include all meta data associated with a channel. When set to false, results contain the minimum amount of meta data necessary to uniquely identify the measurement.

metaData

protected Record metaData
Holds the meta data for a transducer. One is a Record to hand out to getMetaData() requests while the other is a Vector to provide number based indexing.

metaDataVector

protected java.util.Vector metaDataVector
A list of all the current meta data for the TIM. Index zero contains meta data for the TIM itself.

chanDefaults

protected Measurement[] chanDefaults
Holds default values used when constructing a new measurement result. This is nominally all the channel meta data without any values.

lastChanValues

protected Measurement[] lastChanValues
Holds a copy of the last Measurement produced by each channel. The values are set by the readChannels method

eventTypeChannel

protected boolean[] eventTypeChannel
An array indicating if a channel should include the previous value as part of the result Measurement. A channel that indicates it is of type CHANNEL_T_EVENT_SENSOR will automatically have this property set true.

namesToChan

protected java.util.Hashtable namesToChan
A helper object containing a mapping from channel name to channel number.

chanToNames

protected java.lang.String[] chanToNames

Method Detail

getMetaID

public abstract java.lang.String getMetaID()
Description copied from interface: TIMInterface
Return the meta data ID for the TIM itself. This is different from the TEDS ids as the TEDS can be dynamic while the TIM id is usually a constant. A suitable string can be generated from http://www.somacon.com/cgi/generateuuid.pl Select the base64 encoded option and remove trailing = characters.

Specified by:
getMetaID in interface TIMInterface
Returns:
A string containing the Meta ID.

getEntityMetaData

public ArgArray getEntityMetaData()

Retrieves the metadata associated with this FunctionBlock instance.

Overrides:
getEntityMetaData in class FunctionBlock
Returns:
metadata instance.

addChannelTeds

public void addChannelTeds(int chNum,
                           Measurement chanMetaData)
Add a channel of meta data to the overall meta data collection. Also update the internal namesToChan hashtable for quick lookup later.

Parameters:
chNum - - The integer channel number used for reads. Use -1 to allow automatic number incrementing and replacment of duplicate channel name teds.
chanMetaData - - The meta data for this channel

setChannelTeds

public void setChannelTeds(java.lang.Object[][][] teds)
Given an array of meta data name/value pairs, initialize the TEDS for this trandsucer. The array contains a list of name/value pairs: private final Object teds[][][] = { // chan0 - meta data about the TIM itself { { MeasAttr.NAME,"MemoryUsage"}, { MeasAttr.DESCRIPTION,"JVM Memory Monitor"}, { MeasAttr.VERSION, "1.0"}, { MeasAttr.MANUFACTURER, "jddac"}, { MeasAttr.METADATA_ID,"BEzaX7tD2RGZ0+ymeNxcTQ:1" }}, // chan1 { { MeasAttr.NAME,"freeMemory"}, { MeasAttr.DESCRIPTION,"JVM Free Memory"}, { MeasAttr.UNITS,"Bytes"}, { MeasAttr.DATA_TYPE,TypeAttr.INTEGER64}, { MeasAttr.METADATA_ID,"QKtw9lNC2RG4auGq4NvsbA:1" }}, // chan2 { { MeasAttr.NAME,"totalMemory"}, { MeasAttr.DESCRIPTION,"JVM Total Memory"}, { MeasAttr.UNITS,"Bytes"}, { MeasAttr.DATA_TYPE,TypeAttr.INTEGER64}, { MeasAttr.METADATA_ID,"OCGQtlZC2RGN4/dmN+Z8eA:1" }} };

Parameters:
teds - - an array of name/value pairs for each channel.

setChannelTeds

protected void setChannelTeds(java.util.Vector teds)

notifyTedsUpdated

public void notifyTedsUpdated(java.util.Vector teds,
                              boolean add)
Notify derived classes that the teds has changed. Most derived classes use fixed teds and as such do not need to implement this method. By default, it does nothing.

Parameters:
teds - The TEDS being updated.
add - True if an add operation was done. False if a replace was done.

resetTeds

public void resetTeds()
Reset the contents of the cached meta data (TEDS). This method will clear out any previously stored meta data for the transducer. It is used when a transducer supports 'hot swap' of it's physical interface which can cause the meta data to be completely different.

getChanNum

public int getChanNum(java.lang.Object chan)
Given a channel name, return the associated channel number. The channel name 'all' is reserved and will return zero when used as an argument to getChanNum. A NullPointer exception will occur if the requested channel name is not known. If the chan argument is an instance of Integer then it is assumed to be the channel number and is returned as the int equivalent value. All other objects are converted to string and looked up in the namesToChan hash table.

Parameters:
chan - - A object indicating the channel to query.
Returns:
- the channel number or -1 if no match was found

getNumChan

public int getNumChan()
Return the number of channels associated with the TIM.

Returns:
the number of channels associated with this TIM.

readChannel

protected Measurement readChannel(int chanNum)
Read a channel indicated by chanNum and return it as an instance of Measurement. This method is typically called by readChannels for each channel requested in a read or readLast call.

Parameters:
chanNum - - an integer specifying which channel (1 to N)to read.
Returns:
the Measurement for the specified channel

readChannels

protected void readChannels(boolean[] list)
Read the list of channels specified by the list argument and place them into the lastChanValues cache. The default implementation of this method is to iterate over the list array and to invoke readChannel on each active channel. This allows a derived class to only implement the readChannel method if desired.

Parameters:
list - - the list of channels to read.

setLastChanValue

protected void setLastChanValue(int chanNum,
                                Measurement newMeas)
Set the last channel value for subsequent retrieval. This method also deals with EVENT_SENSOR type channels by setting the previous value fields for the new measurement.

Parameters:
chanNum - The channel number of the new measurement
newMeas - The new measurement

readLast

public Record readLast(java.util.Vector list)
Description copied from interface: TIMInterface
Returns transducer values specified by list. This method does not block or request production of new values but only returns the last cached values specified by list. This method is most often used in conjunction with the DataReadyInterface to obtain values after notification that new data is available. If list is null all available transducer values are returned.

Specified by:
readLast in interface TIMInterface
Parameters:
list - A list of transducer values to return.
Returns:
A Record containing the requested transducer values.

read

public Record read(java.util.Vector readList)
Description copied from interface: TIMInterface
Reads and returns transducer values specified by list. This method typically blocks until a new transducer measurement has been obtained. For non-blocking reads, use the startRead method in conjunction with the DataReadyInterface. If list is null all available transducer values are returned.

Specified by:
read in interface TIMInterface
Parameters:
readList - A list of transducer values to read.
Returns:
A Record containing the requested transducer values.

write

public void write(Record record)
Description copied from interface: TIMInterface
Writes transducer values. This method will typically block until the transducer values indicated by the record argument have been sucessfully written to the transducer. For non-blocking writes, use the startWrite method in conjunction with the DataReadyInterface. If record is null, a NullPointerException is thrown.

Specified by:
write in interface TIMInterface
Parameters:
record - the values to write to the transducer.

getMetaData

public Record getMetaData()
Description copied from interface: TIMInterface
Assemble a Record instance containing static meta data for all transducer values.

Specified by:
getMetaData in interface TIMInterface
Returns:
The resultant meta data.

getAllTEDS

addDataReadyCallback

public void addDataReadyCallback(DataReadyInterface callback,
                                 java.lang.Object context)
Description copied from interface: TIMInterface
Add a listener to be notified whenever new data is produced. When the transducer produces a new result value it will notify all listeners who have registered their DataReadyInterface. Listeners are notified sequentially in the order in which they are registered.

Specified by:
addDataReadyCallback in interface TIMInterface
Parameters:
callback - an instance of DataReadyInterface to add.
context - A reference to context information provided to the callback.

addDataReadyCallback

public void addDataReadyCallback(DataReadyInterface callback,
                                 java.lang.Object context,
                                 java.util.Vector list)
Description copied from interface: TIMInterface
Add a listener to be notified whenever new data is produced. When the transducer produces a new result value it will notify all listeners who have registered their DataReadyInterface. Listeners are notified sequentially in the order in which they are registered. This method differes from the (@link TIMInterface#addDataReadyCallback(DataReadyInterface, Object)) in that is allows a filter list to be supplied to limit callbacks to only a specified list of channels.

Specified by:
addDataReadyCallback in interface TIMInterface
Parameters:
callback - an instance of DataReadyInterface to add.
context - A reference to context information provided to the callback.
list - A list of channel filter to apply before making a callback.

signalDataReady

protected void signalDataReady(java.util.Vector list)
Notify all objects registered with the addDataReadyCallback method. This method is used when new data is produced by a transducer and is ready for consumption by any interested objects.

signalDataReady

protected void signalDataReady(boolean[] chanList)
Notify all objects registered with the addDataReadyCallback method. This method is used when new data is produced by a transducer and is ready for consumption by any interested objects.

signalDataReady

protected void signalDataReady(java.lang.String name,
                               Measurement meas)
Notify all objects registered for callback that a new measurment value is available. This method is used when new data is produced by a transducer and is ready for consumption by any interested objects.

Parameters:
name - The name of the Measurement.
meas - The new Measurement value for this channel.

signalDataReady

protected void signalDataReady(int chanNum)
Notify all objects registered for callback that a new measurment value is available. This method is used when new data is produced by a transducer and is ready for consumption by any interested objects. The value must have already been set by calling setLastChanValue.

Parameters:
chanNum - The channel number of the Measurement.

signalDataReady

protected void signalDataReady(int chanNum,
                               Measurement meas)
Notify all objects registered for callback that a new measurment value is available. This method is used when new data is produced by a transducer and is ready for consumption by any interested objects.

Parameters:
chanNum - The channel number of the Measurement.
meas - The new Measurement value for this channel.

startRead

public void startRead(java.util.Vector readList)
Description copied from interface: TIMInterface
Initiate a read of transducer values specified by list. If the transducer supports asynchronous reads it will queue up the read and subsequently notify objects registered with the addDataReadyCallback function. Transducers that do not inherently support an asynchronous read will spawn a separate thread to do a blocking read and notify DataReadyInterface listeners.

Specified by:
startRead in interface TIMInterface
Parameters:
readList - A list of transducer values to read.

startRead

public void startRead(boolean[] channelList)
Initiate a read start given a boolean array of channels. This method is called from the startRead(Vector) method and can be over-ridden by derived classes if it is more convenient working with a boolean array list rather than the Vector channel names.

Parameters:
channelList - The list of channels to start a read operation.

startWrite

public void startWrite(Record list)
Description copied from interface: TIMInterface
Initiate a write of transducer values specified by record. If the transducer supports asynchronous writes it will queue up the write. Transducers that do not inherently support an asynchronous write will spawn a separate thread to do a blocking write.

Specified by:
startWrite in interface TIMInterface
Parameters:
list - A list of transducer values to write.

configure

public void configure(ArgArray configuration)
               throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: ConfigurationInterface
Provides a method to configure object properties. The registry argument contains an ArgArray composed named values. Any values that are not specified are assumed to be left unchanged. That is, if a value is not present, do not assume it means 0 or true or some other default. This allows the configure method to be used to set a single value without affecting other values.

Specified by:
configure in interface ConfigurationInterface
Overrides:
configure in class FunctionBlock
Parameters:
configuration - contains incoming configuration parameters as named values.

Name Default Description
FunctionBlock.pubPorts null This section is where the publication topics for the Function Block is specified. There should be an ArgArray named 'result' contained within this section, containing an Argument named 'topic' for each topic that the block is subscribed to. Here is an example: storeMeasurement triggerAlarm

In this example, the block publishes on two topics: storeMeasurement and triggerAlarm.
FunctionBlock.subPorts null This section is where the sybscription topics for the Function Block is specified. There should be an ArgArray named 'trigger' contained within this section, containing an Argument named 'qual' for each topic that the block is subscribed to. Here is an example which defines a "trigger" port that subscribes to the topics "triggerAlarm" and "storeMeasurement": storeMeasurement triggerAlarm

In this example, the block subscribes on two subscription qualifiers: storeMeasurement and triggerAlarm.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
ConfigurationInterface.configure(net.java.jddac.common.type.ArgArray)
